quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Record and Career
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, pacer, quote. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This former LA Laker retired in 1989 as the record holder for most points scored in a career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

questions.question: The St. Louis Cardinals play at what stadium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Busch Stadium

questions.question: What is the birthplace of St. Louis Cardinals outfielder, So Taguchi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hyogo Prefecture

questions.question: In 1973, this person who played for four different NBA teams set a record for blocked shots in one game, with 17.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elmore Smith

questions.question: What former Utah Jazz player set an NBA record for assists in a career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Stockton

questions.question: The St. Louis Cardinals won the World Series for the first time in 1926.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Tony La Russa became St. Louis Cardinals Manager in 1995.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where was the St. Louis Cardinal pitcher Chris Carpenter born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Exeter, New Hampshire

questions.question: This underrated player recorded the very first quadruple-double in NBA history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nate Thurmond

questions.question: In 1962, this former Philadelphia 76er set the record for most points scored in a game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wilt Chamberlain

questions.question: This former Indiana Pacer retired in 2005 as the record holder for most career three-pointers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reggie Miller

questions.question: Thats a winner! is a quote by what famous announcer of the St. Louis Cardinals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Buck

questions.question: Which first baseman was drafted by the St. Louis Cardinals in 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Pujols

questions.question: What position did Mark McGwire play for the St. Louis Cardinals?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1st base

questions.question: This durable player retired in 1997 as the record holder for most games played in a career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Parish

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Career and Toronto Blue Jays
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, title, average. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This former Utah Jazz player, who retired in 2003, set a record for steals in a career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Stockton

questions.question: Who did the Toronto Blue Jays pick in their first ever expansion draft?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Bailor

questions.question: Which team did Dave Stieb hold hitless in 1990 to pitch the first no hitter in Blue Jays history?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cleveland Indians

questions.question: Golf is “a game in which you shout Fore! shoot six, and write down five” according to which popular ABC radio personality?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Harvey

questions.question: Which team did the Toronto Blue Jays beat on October 5, 1985 to win their first division crown.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Yankees

questions.question: Which British novelist and essayist defined sport in this way: “Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war without the shooting.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: In 1990, the Toronto Blue Jays traded Tony Frenandez and Fred McGriff  to San Diego for whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Carter and Roberto Alomar

questions.question: What Blue Jay pitcher was nicknamed Terminator?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Henke

questions.question: This former Houston Rocket, who retired in 2002, set an NBA record for blocks in a career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hakeem Olajuwon

questions.question: What was John Oleruds batting average when he won the batting title in 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: .363

questions.question: Which one of these has not been a Blue Jay player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitch Williams

questions.question: Which of the following NBA marksmen has the best free throw percentage in a career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Price

questions.question: What team did the Toronto Blue Jays beat on May 9, 1990, for their 1000th regular season win?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The White Sox

questions.question: Which player hit  336 homers in 1423 games while playing for the Toronto Blue Jays?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carlos Delgado

questions.question: On what date did the Toronto Blue Jays play their first regular season game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: April 7, 1977

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Sun Belt Conference and Member
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, schools, share. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following schools was not a charter member of the Sun Belt Conference when the conference was formed in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Alabama at Birmingham

questions.question: Which of the following teams did not become a member of Western Athletic Conference (WAC) by leaving the Sun Belt?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Nevada

questions.question: In 1984, the New York Jets began playing their home games in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: Before Arkansas State University went to the New Orleans Bowl in 2005, which Sun Belt Conference school represented the Sun Belt Conference in the Bowl the previous four years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of North Texas

questions.question: Which of the following Sun Belt Conference basketball schools competes in football at the 1-AA level and is therefore not a member of the 1-A Sun Belt for football?

options.text: University of Arkansas at Little Rock

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Western Kentucky University

questions.question: Which team do the Jets share their stadium with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giants

questions.question: In which round was Leon Washington drafted by the New York Jets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4th

questions.question: Which team won the NCAA Womens National Championship in 1985 as a member of the Sun Belt Conference?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old Dominion University

questions.question: What is the only non-public university that is a member of the Sun Belt Conference?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: University of Denver

questions.question: Which one of the following Sun Belt Conference Member schools is not paired up correctly with its mascot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arkansas State - Red Wolves

questions.question: This football player, known as the Jets all-time leading rusher, announced his retirement in July 2007.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Curtis Martin

questions.question: The Sun Belt Conference has never had a team compete in the NCAA Mens Final Four.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What MLB All-Star and University of South Alabama alumnus was voted the leagues all-time greatest baseball player during the leagues 30th Anniversary celebration in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luis Gonzalez

questions.question: Which quarterback led the New York Jets to the super bowl in the 1968- 1969 season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Namath

questions.question: What school was the first to represent the Sun Belt Conference with an At-Large bid to a Bowl Game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Troy University

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Coach and Player
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, world, message. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: To which Notre Dame legend is the following quote attributed? Ive found that prayers work best when you have big players.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knute Rockne

questions.question: Which of the following is not a player whose number was retired by the New York Jets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weeb Ewbank

questions.question: This early Auburn coach said Gentlemen, it is better to have died a small boy than to fumble this football.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Heisman

questions.question: What Notre Dame coach said, Show me a good and gracious loser, and Ill show you a failure.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knute Rockne

questions.question: In January 2006, this person became the youngest head coach in the Jets history.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eric Mangini

questions.question: This person, who coached at Michigan State from 1954-1972, said Football is not a contact sport - it is a collision sport. Dancing is a contact sport.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duffy Daugherty

questions.question: The importance of practice was emphasized in the following statement made by this Notre Dame head coach: Lads, youre not to miss practice unless your parents died or you died.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank Leahy

questions.question: Which Notre Dame coach said, The only qualifications for a lineman are to be big and dumb. To be a back, you only have to be dumb.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Knute Rockne

questions.question: What Arkansas Razorback coach said, The man who complains about the way the ball bounces is likely to be the one who dropped it.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Holtz

questions.question: What year did England host and win the World Cup?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1966

questions.question: This player scored the famous hand of god  goal at the 1986 World Cup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diego Maradonna

questions.question: Which Bear Bryant quarterback said When you win, nothing hurts.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Namath

questions.question: Which University of Alabama coach said, I make my practices real hard because if a player is a quitter, I want him to quit in practice, not in a game.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bear Bryant

questions.question: After USC lost 51-0 to Notre Dame, his postgame message to his team was: All those who need showers, take them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John McKay

questions.question: The World Cup was once known as the Jules Rimet Cup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nation and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, carolina, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 2002, this nation stunned some of soccers big names to reach the semi finals of the World Cup.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Korea

questions.question: In 1986, the North Carolina State University Football team defeated the highly ranked South Carolina team on a miracle Hail Mary pass. Which receiver caught that pass?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danny Peebles

questions.question: In 1954, this nation, widely believed to be the greatest team of all time, were stunned by West Germany in the final.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hungary

questions.question: Which player scored the winning penalty to secure Italys 4th World Cup victory in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fabio Grosso

questions.question: What former North Carolina State coach was buried in a cemetery overlooking the highway so he could see his boys off to play?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Everett Case

questions.question: At the World Cup in 1982, this player was involved in a controversial incident in his countrys semi-final victory.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harald Schumacher

questions.question: In 1983, N.C. State had to win the Atlantic Coast Conference tournament to be included in the National Collegiate Athletic Association field. What three teams did they defeat to win the tournament?

options.text: Duke, South Carolina, and North Carolina
Wake Forest, North Carolina, and Virginia
Wake Forest, Georgia Tech, and Duke

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wake Forest, North Carolina, and Virginia

questions.question: North Carolina State won the 1974 National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball championship, defeating which team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marquette

questions.question: This famous football nation won its first World Cup in 1978.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argentina

questions.question: Terry Gannon was the only member of the 1983 North Carolina State University at Raleigh basketball team to have a successful NBA career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Lorenzo Charles hit the game winning shot in the 1983 NCAA Championship, but what was the name of the player who put up the famous air ball?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Derek Whittenburg

questions.question: Jim Valvanos tenure as North Carolina States head basketball coach came to an end as a result of a National Collegiate Athletic Association investigation spurred on by a tell all book written by Dick Vitale.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these players was not among the starting five in the North Carolina State University 83 basketball championship team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anthony Grundy

questions.question: This nation played a style of soccer termed total football and reached consecutive world cups in the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Holland

questions.question: This country scored one of soccer World Cups biggest upsets when it defeated Brazil at the 1950 World Cup in Brazil
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Uruguay

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Game and Perfect Game
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, phillies, carolina. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What country did the first skater to land a single Salchow skate for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sweden

questions.question: This  great pitcher threw the first perfect game of the 20th century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cy Young

questions.question: For which team did Jim Catfish Hunter pitch a perfect game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Oakland As

questions.question: After defeating Houston in the 1983 National Collegiate Athletic Association championship, North Carolina State did not make the field for the 1984 NCAA tournament.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is not the name of a pitcher who threw a perfect game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Johnson

questions.question: From 1880 to 1903 only two perfect games were thrown. Who were the two winning pitchers?

options.text: Walter Johnson and Harry Suitcase Simpson
John Lee Richmond and John Montgomery Ward

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Lee Richmond and John Montgomery Ward

questions.question: A thirty-six year old pitcher threw a perfect game for the Montreal Expos on July 28, 1991. Who was the wining pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis  Martinez

questions.question: May 15, 1981 saw a perfect game involving the Toronto Blue Jays and the Cleveland Indians. Who was the winning pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Len Barker

questions.question: In 1987, North Carolina State University defeated what team in the longest basketball game of the year, played in the Atlantic Coast Conference tournament?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wake Forest

questions.question: Big Don No-Hit Larson pitched a perfect game for the Yankees. What was extra special about his perfect game?

options.text: It was played in the American League Championship  series.
Larson hit two homers to win the game for the Yankees.
It was played in the World Series.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was played in the World Series.

questions.question: Select the best definition for a perfect game in Major League baseball.

options.text: Any baseball game in which the losing side never gets a runner safely on base
Any baseball game of at least 9 innings in which the losing  side gets no hits, gets no walks, and never reaches base safely on an error
Any game in which the pitcher or pitchers throw a complete game of nine or more innings without  surrendering a base runner
Any baseball game in which the pitcher allows no hits, no walks, no hit batsmen and in which the winning team commits no errors

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Any game in which the pitcher or pitchers throw a complete game of nine or more innings without  surrendering a base runner

questions.question: A perfect game was pitched for the Philadelphia Phillies on June 21, 1964. What was extra special about this game?

options.text: It was the first time a lefty pitched a perfect game.
The losing team won the World Series that year.
Because of rain the game lasted over four  hours.
The wining pitcher later became a member of the US House of Representatives.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The wining pitcher later became a member of the US House of Representatives.

questions.question: In the September 30, 1984 game between the California Angels and the Texas Rangers, Mike Witt threw a perfect game. What was the final score?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Angels 1 Rangers 0

questions.question: Jim Quick umpired a perfect game on September 16, 1988. Tom Browning was the winning pitcher for the home team. The game was played at Riverfront Stadium. Name the wining team.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Reds

questions.question: On July 28, 1994 a perfect game was pitched in Arlington, Texas. This time the Rangers beat the Angels. Who was the wining pitcher?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kenny Rogers
